CatDescriptText: "Shorts" Davis, entertainer, Lawrenceville, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 10, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that the 'Freedom Riders' should accede to Atty. Gen. Robert Kennedy's request for a 'cooling-off' period in their program to test segregation laws of certain Southern states?" answer reads: "It would be a good idea to go along with the Attorney General, I think, because his brother, President Kennedy, seems to be on our side."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Closeup image of building; Portrait of "Shorts" Davis wearing light colored button down collared shirt, standing in front of store with arched doorway
